intro: Osmia bartsiifolia, commonly known as the Bartsiifolia mason bee, is a species of solitary bee native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Megachilidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinctive black and yellow coloration. The plant is closely associated with its host plants, primarily species of the genus Fagaceae, such as oaks and beeches. Osmia bartsiifolia plays a vital role in pollination, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat. Its botanical significance lies in its specific ecological interactions and potential for conservation efforts.
